result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaquellie T Evans

records.addlTxt:
1:32 PM Defendant Shaquellie T Evans in court, in custody.  Attorney Natalie L. Wisco in court for Shaquellie T Evans.  Attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address Defense's motions to dismiss Ct 2 and motion to suppress.
State calls Officer N. Knierim, DSAT. Cross by Defense. Redirect by State. Recross by Defense. Defense marks dashcam as exhibit 1. State doesn't object to exhibit being moved in. 
BTC: Exhibit 1 will be received. 
Parties give argument. 
BTC: DENIED.

2:14 PM Defendant Shaquellie T Evans in court, in custody.  Attorney Natalie L. Wisco in court for Shaquellie T Evans.  Attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address Defense's motions to dismiss Ct 2 and motion to suppress.
State indicates he forget to subpoena the officer for today but is available for Thursday.  
Defense objects to adjournment of motion date since this is the second date this has been an issue. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, confirmed and verified work and or schooling, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Defendant may also go to any confirmed and verified prenatal appointments for the mother of his child. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

1:38 PM Defendant Shaquellie T Evans in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Natalie L. Wisco in court for Shaquellie T Evans. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Matter set to address Defense's motions to dismiss Ct 2 and motion to suppress. 
State indicates that their officer is not available and are not prepared to proceed today but understand they will not be able to proceed next week for trial. 
Defense objects to adjournment. 
BTC: JT removed, $10,000 signature bond with GPS exception for confirmed and verified work and or school, attorney visits, and medical appointments including prenatal care Avalon Dawson.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

11:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shaquellie T Evans in court, in custody.  Attorney Natalie L. Wisco in court for Shaquellie T Evans. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense requests an adjournment, was only recently retained.
State is prepared to proceed with the hearing.
BTC: Adjournment request denied, court proceeds with preliminary hearing.

Court takes Judicial Notice of prior Felony Conviction.
